snippet: In a televised visit to the hospital bed of a woman assaulted in Tahrir Square, President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared his commitment to combat sexual violence against women in Egypt.
abstract: Egypt's Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi apologizes to the victim of a mass sexual assault that took place in a crowd celebrating his election; during televised visit to woman's hospital bed, he urges every soldier, police officer and 'chivalrous man' to eradicate such abuse; visit and apology, on his third day in office, are orchestrated to convey his determination to combat sexual violence against women.
lead_paragraph: In a televised visit to the hospital bed of a woman assaulted in Tahrir Square, President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared his commitment to combat sexual violence against women in Egypt.

headline.main: Egyptian Leader Apologizes to Victim of Sexual Assault in Tahrir Square
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Leader Apologizes to Victim of Sexual Assault in Tahrir Square

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
